Author: zamanat
Title: Zamanat - Rides and Safety (ICO Pre-sale on Feb 20, 2018)
Body: Zamanat - Rides and Safety ICO Pre-sale staring on Feb 20, 2018  Introduction  Zamanat is an encrypted ride-hailing and personal safety app that protects your privacy. Unlike other ride-hailing services, Uber and Lyft Zamanat uses end-to-end encryption to keep the communication between the users and drivers private. End-to-end encryption makes it almost impossible for a third party or even the Zamanat’s service provider to gain access to the users’ travel data. With Zamanat the users have the full authority to choose who can track their location. The users can allow friends and family to track them regardless of hailing a ride to have a companion on their side.  Zamanat uses a blockchain based user authentication. The cryptography based security system on the distributed network of blockchain makes the users’ credentials secure and tamper-proof.  With Zamanat we are also introducing Zamanat Token (ZMT). ZMT is an Ethereum based cryptocurrency token that can be used as a payment method on Zamanat. Zamanat will also support credit/debit cards, PayPal, and Stripe as payment methods.  Links  Website: https://zamanat.net/ Whitepaper: https://zamanat.net/whitepaper Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/zamanat.net/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/Zamanat_net Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/user/zamanat/  ICO Pre-sale and ICO  We are crowdfunding our project through an ICO pre-sale and ICO.  ICO pre-sale - Feb 20, 2018 ICO first phase - April 1, 2018 ICO second phase - April 26, 2018  We need your help to bring user privacy to a ride-hailing service. To participate in the ICO pre-sale and ICO, visit our website https://zamanat.net

Author: Briz234
Title: Zamanat - Rides and Safety (ICO Pre-sale on Feb 20, 2018)
Body: In the White papers of the Zamanat project - Travel and security, I read that a security system based on cryptography in a distributed network blockchain makes the user credentials safe and protected from unauthorized access. I read a lot there. It was informative. But I still do not understand, will the project have its own bounty campaign?
